latex:
Let $f_1(x)=\sqrt{1-x}$, and for integers $n \ge 2$, let $f_n(x)=f_{n-1}(\sqrt{n^2-x})$. If $N$ is the largest value of $n$ for which the domain of $f_n$ is nonempty, the domain of $f_N$ is ${c}$. What is $N+c$?\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\  -226 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ -144 \qquad
\textbf{(C)}\  -20 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 20 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 144$
